div.a: The Secret Portal That Led To The Atomic Bomb

div.div: There it was, completely nondescript. Nobody could ever tell what the room was used for more than half a century ago. But then I thought that that sounded apt; after all, nobody was supposed to know in the first place what went on in there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z7mXRN&via=Digg&text=The Secret Portal That Led To The Atomic Bomb

div.div: Carrie Fisher confirms that she will be returning to Star Wars.

div.a: How Twitter Rebuilt Google's Secret Weapon

div.div: This software system is called Borg, and it’s one of the best-kept secrets of Google’s rapid evolution into the most dominant force on the web. Wilkes won’t even call it Borg. “I prefer to call it the system that will not be named,” he says.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YsizLY&via=Digg&text=How Twitter Rebuilt Google's Secret Weapon

div.a: The Last Taboo In Porn

div.div: When it comes to things they won’t do on camera, a surprising number of adult-film stars draw the line at interracial sex.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y9QaqP&via=Digg&text=The Last Taboo In Porn

div.a: You Can Now Bring Some Knives On Planes

div.div: The U.S. Transportation Security Administration will let people carry small pocketknives onto passenger planes for the first time since the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, along with golf clubs, hockey sticks and plastic Wiffle Ball-style bats.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13CRpXh&via=Digg&text=You Can Now Bring Some Knives On Planes

div.a: Your Fat Has A Brain, And It's Trying To Kill You

div.div: Body fat is just an inert layer of blubber, right? If only. New research shows that it's more like a toxic parasite that doesn't want to let go. The good news: if you exercise and eat right, you can force it to.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/101tJav&via=Digg&text=Your Fat Has A Brain, And It's Trying To Kill You

div.a: Hugo Chavez Dies From Cancer

div.div: Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez has died after a two-year battle with cancer, ending the socialist leader's 14-year rule of the South American country, Vice President Nicolas Maduro said in a televised speech.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WrMwyr&via=Digg&text=Hugo Chavez Dies From Cancer

div.a: Facebook Changes Led Users To Reveal More

div.div: Facebook users began sharing more private data after the social network giant revamped its policies and interface, according to a study released Tuesday.

div.div: NOT TO BE CONFUSED WITH iSCROLL

div.a: Eye-Scroll Web Pages On Your Next Phone

div.div: Samsung’s new Galaxy S IV might be worth paying attention to, especially since it’s expected to boast an exciting new feature that’s anything but forgettable: Eye-scrolling.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XLggn6&via=Digg&text=Eye-Scroll Web Pages On Your Next Phone

div.a: See The Sun Up Close In Live Webcast Today

div.div: The sun's solar weather cycle is it at its peak this year, and today you can get an up-close look at Earth's nearest star through an Arizona telescope in a live webcast.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/109VJN4&via=Digg&text=See The Sun Up Close In Live Webcast Today

div.a: At 106, Man Finally Gets An Elusive High School Diploma

div.div: Fred Butler has done many things in his 106 years, from serving in two military theaters of World War II to helping raise five children. But he had never gone to high school, or earned a diploma.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1030Pab&via=Digg&text=At 106, Man Finally Gets An Elusive High School Diploma

div.a: Why American Eggs Would Be Illegal In A British Supermarket, And Vice Versa

div.div: One would imagine that eggs on either side of the Atlantic are the same. Of course, technically they are. But, as for how they are processed after they hit the ground, now that’s where the differences come in.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RYbiyx&via=Digg&text=Why American Eggs Would Be Illegal In A British Supermarket, And Vice Versa

div.a: 'Legends Of The Hidden Temple' As Remembered By A Former Contestant

div.div: The Temple Run, the final round of Legends of the Hidden Temple, was among the greatest spectacles in 1990s children's television. Unless you were the one doing the running -- in which case, a one-time contestant recalls, it was terrible.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XQR27S&via=Digg&text='Legends Of The Hidden Temple' As Remembered By A Former Contestant

div.div: The Federal Bureau of Investigation said Tuesday it is investigating an unidentified black drone an Alitalia pilot said he encountered while approaching John F. Kennedy International Airport.

div.a: In China, Faking Pregnancy Is One Way To Get A Seat On The Subway

div.div: Snagging a seat on the subway or crosstown bus ain't always easy, especially in China's crowded cities. That's why, according to The Beijing News, "pregnancy pads" are supposedly hot sellers.

div.a: Why Do Weather People Suck At Predicting Snow

div.div: With a major storm just hours away, Washington sits on the razor’s edge, still not knowing if the precipitation event will be mostly solid or mostly liquid, whether it will be an epic snowstorm worthy of the name Snowquester or just a sloppy, wet, puddle-making mess.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wt3Xyx&via=Digg&text=Why Do Weather People Suck At Predicting Snow

div.a: Reading The Same Book Over And Over Helps You Learn Faster (If You're A Baby)

div.div: Weary parents may roll their eyes at their toddlers’ insistence to have the same book read over and over, but a new study by the University of Sussex finds that the repetition is important for little learners.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wr9N3j&via=Digg&text=Reading The Same Book Over And Over Helps You Learn Faster (If You're A Baby)

div.a: What's The Difference Between Churches, Chapels, And Cathedrals?
